channel.title: No-ip and static ip
channel.description: okay i noticed that my server was connecting to my static ip. in order to portforward my server i have to get a static ip and put that static ip as the lan ip. so instead of connecting to the no -ip it connects to my static ip. and when i try to put my no-ip as the lan it wont let me does this mean i have to use my static ip instead of my no-ip?

item.title: No-ip and static ip
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

when you sign up for no-ip make sure that you use your static ip for the connection, lots of people make this mistake and put there lan ip which is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip and static ip
item.dc:creator: @ppvagina ppvagina
item.description:
@ppvagina wrote:

okay i noticed that my server was connecting to my static ip. in order to portforward my server i have to get a static ip and put that static ip as the lan ip. so instead of connecting to the no -ip it connects to my static ip. and when i try to put my no-ip as the lan it wont let me does this mean i have to use my static ip instead of my no-ip?
